pull.title: [Qt] Add option to increase/decrease font size in the console window
pull.body: Allows to increase/decrease the console font size. Font size will be persisted over `QSettings` (survives a restart). Default size is unified over all platform. Rearranged the "clear icon" and the ">" (shell prompt). Possible future extension: allow switching between system default- and monospace-font.

events.body:
~~Doesn't link here.~~

This was bug in my build scripts (the new files in icons/... were missing).

While compiling:

```
qt/forms/debugwindow.ui: Warning: The name 'horizontalLayout' (QHBoxLayout) is already in use, defaulting to 'horizontalLayout1'.
```

@paveljanik: Thanks!
Fixed the "already in use" warning and added the missing icon (travis should be happy now).

Works OK here.

Nits: the warning above. The tooltips contain Caps Text (Decrease _F_ont _S_ize) - compare with Clear _c_onsole.
~~@jonasschnelli IIRC icons were OK on your side - this was my local issue :-)~~

issue.title: Qt/OS X: Ctrl-L mentioned to clear screen and doesn't work
issue.body: On OS X: Ctrl-L mentioned and doesn't work anyway (Cmd should be used and should work). The X in the circle button works OK though.

events.body: Concept ACK, nice, this should end the complaints about the font size.

events.message: [Qt] Add option to increase/decrease font size in the console window

events.body:
Tested ACK 3a3a927

Nit: can it be done so that it doesn't jump back to the top of the window? It requires that you have to scroll all the way down if the size is changed when there is a lot of text there.

events.message: [Qt] keep scroll position in GUI console after changing font size

events.body:
Added another commit.
Now the scroll-list keeps the vertical position (percentage) after changing the font size.

Would be nice if someone could re-test.
Fontsizes are OK, vertical scrollbar OK. But I do not like the cursor change (but maybe this is because I'm too old to remember real cursors ;-).

agree with @paveljanik: (re)added a Icon that indicates the promot line. Removed the placeholder text in the input field itself.
Also added copyright attributions.
There is "Decrease font size" tooltip over the new prompt icon (probably cut&paste issue):

issue.title: qt re-implementation of manage names
issue.body:
This is a merge and partial re-write of "manage names" tab from namecoin legacy on top of namecoin-core. I used the RPC functions, internally, to do the heavy lifting. The previous QT UI duplicated much of the code. I also moved the manage names UI from a separate popup to a tab in the main UI.

I tried to keep the patch footprint as small as possible. If anyone sees room to make it even smaller, please comment. A major goal here was to minimize the probability of conflicts in the future.

Some of the code you see here is directly merged from the legacy names page UI. Please let me know if you see problems in it.

Some areas that warrant extra consideration:
- The changes in `src/qt/transactionrecord.cpp` were 100% taken from legacy. They might not be necessary.
- The changes in `walletdb.cpp` are very important and should have code review.
- Testing using different QT/GUI config settings would be helpful

milestone.title: nc0.12.0
milestone.description: This is the release before the BIP9 hardfork release.

issue.title: [backport] Qt Debug Window / Rpc Console improvements
issue.body:
This is a set of backports that gives the GUI RPC console most of the improvements in Core 0.13.0:

- bitcoin#7317, a security fix around timers, seems to have been partly imported previously.  This completes the import.
- bitcoin#7396 and bitcoin#7668 add font-size increase/decrease buttons in the RPC console
- bitcoin#7613 and bitcoin#7772 and bitcoin#8129 add auto-complete to the RPC console
- bitcoin#7732 replaces build-date with DataDir in the information tab

The above seem good in light testing here
